name: Manhatta
address: 28 Liberty St 60th floor, New York, NY 10005, USA

reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about Manhatta . This was by far the best date my husband and I have ever went on . We got lost (first time in NYC) and showed up 30 minutes late to our reservation and the hostesses and waitress managed to still make it an amazing experience for us . We did a 4 course meal and every dish was perfection . The atmosphere is so fun and light and watching the all the chefs and waiters work together was amazing . They put in extra effort into everything they did . I will definitely be coming back next time Iâ€™m in New York

Dining at Manhatta feels like floating above the city â€” surrounded by glass, sky, and light.
The menu isnâ€™t about extravagance, but about quiet precision: each plate delicate, modern, and deeply satisfying.
The true star, though, is the view â€” an ever-changing canvas of Manhattanâ€™s skyline that turns dinner into something cinematic.
A place where you go not just to eat, but to pause, breathe, and remember why New York feels infinite.
TrÃ¨s bel endroit  cadre remarquable et super cuisine
Had the best time celebrating my birthday in New York! ğŸ‰ It was a total surprise dinner â€” amazing food and super friendly service. Canâ€™t wait to come back to New York and here again!
Service avec personnel Ã  lâ€™Ã©coute et compÃ©tent, trÃ¨s jolie vue sur Manhattan, je recommande !
Great food, great views, amazing service. Thank you!
Sitting at the bar is very enjoyable particularly when you have one of the best burgers in the city in front of you

I visited Manhattan twice during a recent business trip from Ireland, and both visits were absolutely outstanding.
On our first night, we arrived without a reservation and were asked to wait briefly before being escorted up to the bar area on the 60th floor. We were initially seated at a table back from the bar, but when seats opened up, the staff kindly offered to move us right up to the bar â€” a thoughtful touch that really set the tone for the evening. The views over midtown Manhattan at night were spectacular, and the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming.
We enjoyed it so much that we decided to return the next evening, this time with a party of eight. Once again, the staff were friendly, professional, and accommodating. After a short wait, we were brought to a beautiful corner alcove with an incredible view through a massive window â€” the kind of view that makes you just stop and take it all in.
A little while later, our server came over and asked if weâ€™d like to move to a couch area. To our surprise, he brought us into the Bay Room â€” normally reserved for private events â€” since it wasnâ€™t booked that evening. He gave us a spacious couch area with the most breathtaking view looking west at sunset over Liberty Island. It was truly magical, and without a doubt one of the highlights of my entire week in New York.
The ambience at Manhattan is spot-on: background music at just the right level, great for conversation, and a fantastic selection of cocktails and drinks. But what really makes this place stand out is the people â€” the staff and management. Theyâ€™re professional, thoughtful, and genuinely kind. Itâ€™s clear the whole operation is very well run and guest-focused.
I canâ€™t recommend Manhattan highly enough. Itâ€™s an elegant, well-managed venue with world-class views and even better service. Iâ€™ll definitely be returning the next time Iâ€™m in New York.
I love the view and customer service, it was an amazing experience!

I have had this place on my radar for years! I saw pictures of the view online. It seemed to have all of the best elements for an elevated (Literal & Figurative) restaurant. Unfortunately, it's sometimes hard to corral all of the members of the friend-group. Since I couldn't "assemble The Avengers." I reserved Manhatta for a solo visit.

I was called in to the Manhattan HQ of my employer on a Tuesday. As the day was ending I was poking around my map of flags, looking for a rooftop. I figured I would skip rush hour, have dinner and then drive back after the "rat race" had cleared up. Manhatta popped up, with reservation space so I booked it, then booked it downtown from 34th St. I'm so glad I did!

I went with the four course option. Surprisingly, the waiter said that some people feel like that's too much food. I thought the portions were perfect and I went all the way through to dessert. My choices were as follows, Hamachi Crudo, Spanish Octopus, and Sea Bass. My dessert choice was their signature Toasted Rice Millefeuille with Koshikari Rice Cream and hazelnut caramel. The courses all "hit" on every level (Taste, presentation, color, smell etc.) In between they also provided some extra small bites as well as pallet-cleansers.

While I marveled at the view (270Â° Stunning degrees)... and the food... I also had some wine (Sauvignon Blanc), but they also had this cocktail called "The Coconut Exchange" (If I recall correctly), and that bad boy stole the show for me! I would've ordered two but rush hour driving was looming. Cocktail lovers, try that first!

Meanwhile, THE SERVICE, very very good. They were attentive but not obtrusive. Everyone seemed genuinely kind. When I say, "everyone," I mean Everyone, including hosts, Maitre'Ds, waiters, waitresses etc. I'm not sure why this place doesn't have a Michelin Star. My Manhatta experience rivaled that of other Michelin-rated restaurants I've been to around NYC, maybe even the world.

Speaking of service, before I leave, I want to give a big shoutout to the curly-haired, blonde, petite waitress, Nina (?). We had a few short mini-conversations about the cocktails, the view and even her travels to South Korea. Her calm demeanor and kindness punctuated the service for me. Go ahead and promote her! If anyone asks why, tell them that one of the representatives of one of the biggest labor unions in the country said so, haha!

Bottom Line: Make the trip to visit, but this place is so good, you might want to reserve it for a special celebration or anniversary. (One of my friends from college said he proposed to his wife there and now it all makes sense). ;-)

Last night, my brother and I were fortunate enough to celebrate his birthday at Manhatta. From start to finish, it was an amazing evening! The staff went out of their way to personalize the experience with birthday wishes (which started with the friendly hostess in the lobby), a message on the table, and a birthday dessert treat! These gestures were much appreciated! The service was exceptional. Pete and Keir were our main servers, and they were wonderful - very personable, knowledgeable, attentive, and professional. The support team was equally as good. A special shout-out to Eric, who I believe made my fabulous lemon-drop martinis! The four-course menu was exquisite and included complimentary palate cleansers and delicious sour-dough bread. Every dish was flavorful and creatively presented. And, of course, the views are stunning! I highly recommend Manhatta for your next dining experience, be it a special occasion or simply an excuse to spoil yourself with fabulous food and service!

The food here was absolutely delicious every bite was full of flavor. The staff were friendly and attentive, making the whole experience enjoyable. The restaurant had a cozy atmosphere that made us feel right at home. I'll definitely be coming back for more
Amazing
I was there for a private sponsored event.   The views are amazing!  The staff was top notch!  Food was ok.  To be fair we did have a custom limited menu.
I had the best burger of my entire life and the staff was amazing

This was a very exceptional experience from beginning to end!  Everyone was incredibly attentive, helpful, and courteous. The food was delicious and perfectly prepared. Our server was super knowledgeable about the menu and made some good recommendations around our specific tastes.
Best experience with 3course meal
Nemam reci apsolutno fantasticno
Always incredible service and atmosphere
The whole family celebrated my birthday there. Loved every detail from the four-course offerings, to the greetings, and the stunning view. Cannot be happier.

Reservamos con un mes de antelaciÃ³n y no nos dieron ni una mesa. Nos terminaron sentando en la barra con vistas a la cocina (Perfecto! Justo lo que buscaba yendo a un rooftop!). La comida no es gran cosa para el precio.
Defraudado
Always great views, great service, great cocktails.
Great cocktails. I only visited the bar. The views!!!!

A Perfect Wedding ğŸ’
We got married here a couple of months ago, and the experience was absolutely wonderful. The entire team was accommodating, patient, and clear in communication â€” even with our reception being planned in a hurry.

The food was top-notch and enjoyed by guests of all ages, especially the fish entrÃ©e â€” a clear favorite! The view from the reception hall was breathtaking; you hardly need any extra decoration when the river + skyline backdrop does all the work.

The staff went above and beyond, helping us set up the tables exactly as we envisioned, coordinating flower deliveries, and guiding guests smoothly upon arrival. Everything came together beautifully, and we couldnâ€™t have asked for a better venue for our special day.
We had an exceptional anniversary dinner! The food was incredible and the service was top-tier. And of course, the views were amazing! I cannot recommend enough.

We hosted an event in the Whitman ballroom at Manhatta and had an incredible experience from start to finish. The venue is absolutely stunning â€“ sweeping city views and the most beautiful sunset in NYC! The food was phenomenal, and the staff went above and beyond to make the evening flawless.

Special shout out to the entire team that made it all happen - especially Allie, Jeremy, Miranda, Amy and Niko - thank you for your exceptional hospitality and professionalism. A true 10/10 experience!

Celebrated a friendâ€™s birthday here and the views definitely made it a memorable spot! Had the steak (portion could have been better), the Gold Bar Squash with sauce ravigote side which was really really good,  Potato Chips with umami powder was lacking the umami powder so it ended up tasting like your average crisps from a bag. Had the berry me in nyc which was delish. For dessert we had the Toasted Rice Millefeuille with Koshihikari Rice Cream and Hazelnut Cream which was prettier than how it tasted but the Milk Chocolate chicory mousse with white coffee cremeux and black cherry ice cream was so beautifully complex.
Beautiful views, excellent food and super friendly staff

We stopped just for a drink and had a good cocktail, awesome view and a nice conversation with the bartender Dan, "the man". Dan will prepare you a great cocktail.
Definitely recommend if you visit NYC

The food was excellent, but the  main server was absolutely unbearable. He was pushy and overbearing, kept interrupting us, all to get on his or the restaurants schedule.  We were near the end of the night so this might be a systemic issue rather than a server issue.  Perhaps the chef and his crew are late for a hot date?  In any case, regardless of the good food, I would not return here because of the "Karen" nature of the main server.  I think he forgot whose experience he is meant to optimize.,.
Phenomenal views, great cocktail variety, fair prices, and an exceptional bartender - huge shoutout to Ela!
The only thing impressed me was how many staffs they have ğŸ˜’

Manhatta is simply spectacular!!!  the food is refined and bursting with flavor, and the view is absolutely breathtaking. Every dish feels thoughtfully crafted, perfectly matching the stunning New York skyline that stretches out before you. A truly memorable dining experience from start to finish. We will be back!

This place is awesome, like actual awe.
The female bartender on Tuesday was the best.
Big shout out to all the staff that make this happen

Got food poisoning from the sea bass, it smelled incredibly fishy and later in the day was very nauseous and sick. For the amount we paid to eat here, extremely disappointed in that. Atmosphere and service were good though
Manhatta has one of the best event spaces for wine and food pairings. Along with the amazing views and the ability to custom move walls. The desserts are some of the best.
Amazing experience. Beautiful views, great service and the food was Michelin quality IMO. Highly recommend!

A beautiful spot on the 60th floor with stunning viewsâ€”be sure to book ahead and request a window seat. The food was good, though it lacked the wow factor youâ€™d expect from a restaurant at this level.

Amazing place. We grabbed a drink at the bar first, and then we moved to the table in the main dining room, and everything was incredible. Ambiance, service, food, and an outstanding view...

Another visit, another great experience.
Super tasty food and attentive service.
Thank you, Amy, for outstanding hospitality.
Beautiful place, great atmosphere, amazing views and great food.

We had the great pleasure of dining at Manhatta in New York â€“ and it was truly an unforgettable experience!
We chose the 4-course menu, and every single dish was a genuine explosion of flavors. Creative, perfectly balanced, and of the highest quality â€“ a true culinary highlight.

The staff was extremely friendly, attentive, and professional without ever feeling overbearing. A special treat was our window seat on the 60th floor, offering an absolutely breathtaking view of the Manhattan skyline â€“ the perfect harmony of fine dining and atmosphere.

An evening at Manhatta is much more than just dinner â€“ itâ€™s an experience for all the senses. Absolutely recommended!
Such an amazing dining experience! Every single staff person was so gracious and hospitable. The food was absolutely incredible. I can't wait to return!
This was one of the best meals and experiences i have ever had. Thank you Manhatta team for such wonderful hospitality! we will definitely be back soon.
Wish the weather was better but had a lovely time here. The octopus was ğŸ”¥still think about it 6 months later
Nice view but otherwise terribly managed and a waste of time and money.

They make you wait for 30 minutes to get a seat for a bar and once youâ€™re up there, you have to wait another 30 minute to stand at the side table to get a seat that doesnâ€™t even have a view not worth it

Manhatta is an outstanding establishment. This restaurant is one of the few in NYC to focus on delivering a quality experience for its customers. Not only does Manhatta offer a delightful menu with exceptionally prepared dishes (the burger is undoubtedly the best in the city), but it also provides a first-class dining experience, set in a chic, yet welcoming atmosphere.

The service, however, is where the restaurant comes into its own. I have been to Manhatta at least a dozen times, and the service from waiters to managers is never short of excellent. During our most recent visit, there was an unfortunate incident involving a significant spill of a special bottle we corkaged; however, without hesitation, the entire team dealt with the matter professionally, promptly, and fairly, leaving us grateful for their attentiveness and character.

Manhatta is a delight and well worth visiting time and time again.

I came here for the second time. Their lunch options are very limited. The front desk staff was very nice, but the point is that today's dining experience was terrible. The person who took the order didn't smile at all and there was no table service. He definitely he in a very bad mood today. During the entire meal, no waiter came to ask if we needed anything. No pre-meal bread was provided to us (we saw other tables had it). It was my birthday today, the dining area staff and including the waiter who took the order, were not very polite and had no service attitude. I spent 350 dollars to get such service, which was very bad.
Called the reservationist to speak about pricing and get an idea of a cost of a meal for 2 people. Her response was â€œI donâ€™t know you do the mathâ€. Thanks Becky! Iâ€™ll do the math.

This restaurant has it all. It deserves a Michelin star or two as far as the food goes.  The flavors and the presentation are top notch. Add to that a knowledgeable and friendly staff, and that would be enough to make for a great dining experience. But wait, there's more! The view! 60 stories up with most of Manhattan, the Hudson, the East River and beyond all in your field of view. Put it all together and you will have an amazing and memorable dining experience.

We had an absolutely wonderful experience at Manhatta. We started the evening with drinks at the bar, and the view alone was worth the visitâ€”panoramic, breathtaking, and the perfect way to set the tone for dinner. The bar team was fantastic, and the atmosphere up there is just stunning.

We were celebrating a special occasion, and the staff made it memorable. Despite already ordering two bottles of wine, they surprised us with complimentary glasses of champagne and an extra dessert at the endâ€”such a thoughtful and generous gesture.

The food was excellent across the boardâ€”elegant, well-executed, and full of flavor. The whole experience felt elevated yet relaxed, and the service was attentive without being overbearing.

Would definitely recommend Manhatta for anyone looking to celebrate something specialâ€”or just enjoy one of the best views in the city with great food and warm hospitality.

Weâ€™ve been here a few times and Sam has been our server on two occasions. Heâ€™s the best! Last time we were here for lunch on Aug 4. We were seated beside the window and it was pleasant to admire the view outside while dining. The food was fine, except my motherâ€™s fish entrÃ©e arrived undercooked and raw inside. She felt a bit sick afterwards. However, when she told Sam he immediately offered to have the dish replaced, which made up for it. She did enjoy the fish the second time around, once it was cooked properly. The great service made up for the mishap with the food. We had an enjoyable lunch overall - Sam really made the difference and turned it from an average meal to a standout experience.

My friend made a reservation for us, and it was a stunning experience. The view, food/drinks, service were all amazing. It was one of the best ducks Iâ€™ve ever had.

Itâ€™s a beautiful space and if anyone wants to celebrate special occasions or quality time Iâ€™d highly recommend.

I love the views from here! Very beautiful: the inside of the restaurant is wonderful. The service is great and they are really on top of it! I went for restaurant week and the food was very good! But it just wasnâ€™t incredibly memorable so I took a star off. But I still had a great time.

An incredible experience! From the food, to the views, to the service, there was not one thing I wish had been done differently!

The food:
We started with the Hamachi and Tortellini. The tortellini was cooked to perfection with a delicious sauce. It definitely stole the show and I would highly recommend ordering it.

Our waiter recommended the Dry Aged Duck, which I have never had, and I was so glad I went with his recommendation. Definitely going to add it to my palette. They also provided delicious bread throughout the meal.

Finally, the dessert. The best restaurant dessert Iâ€™ve ever had. Frankly, I donâ€™t even remember the exact names, but they provided this cake like treat for my fiances birthday as well and it was incredible.

The service and view couldnâ€™t have been any better and I definitely look forward to coming back for a meal. They also provided binoculars so you can see the city at an even more incredible view.

5/5 for Manhatta.

Amazing views and fantastic service. Came here to celebrate my birthday, and it was perfect. A birthday card was a nice touch. You get to choose between 3 or 4 course tasting menu and also get a pre-appetizer and a pallet cleaner between main and desert. Everything was delicious and of course the presentation was beautiful. Magnifecent views most definitely add to the experience, especially if you are lucky to sit by the window, it is very romantic. Hope to be back one day.

Iâ€™ve been to Manhatta a few times for drinks and it never disappoints. The views are absolutely stunningâ€”almost 360Â° of the city since the restaurant takes up the entire floor. It feels like youâ€™re floating above Manhattan with iconic landmarks in every direction. I love that one side has a lively, busy vibe while the other is much more quiet and romantic, so you can choose the atmosphere youâ€™re in the mood for.

The cocktails are excellent, the staff is consistently friendly and welcoming, and I was pleasantly surprised that thereâ€™s usually little to no wait at the bar even without a reservation. Overall, itâ€™s a beautiful spot whether you want an energetic night out or a more intimate evening. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back to try the food.

Where do I start?

From the moment we arrived we were treated royally. Their selection of bourbon is phenomenal and they actually had Pappy 10 year in stock!

The food was exceptional. Service was excellent.

Not to mention the view!

Iâ€™ll be back any time Iâ€™m in NYC!

Visiting this restaurant was an unforgettable experience!
The breathtaking panoramic view of New York City alone is worth the visit â€” it feels like youâ€™re dining among the stars. The food was absolutely exquisite: every dish was a masterpiece, beautifully presented and bursting with flavor.
The service was impeccable â€” warm, attentive, and genuinely caring. We were also surprised with thoughtful compliments from the chef, which made the evening even more special.
A perfect place for anyone looking to combine world-class cuisine with an unforgettable atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Manhatta exceeded our expectations in every way! We chose it to celebrate a birthday and it was the perfect spot. The food was creative and delicious, the service was attentive and knowledgeable, and the view was simply breathtaking. We loved the upscale atmosphere and the friendly staff. It was our first time there, but it definitely won't be our last. Highly recommend Manhatta for a special occasion or just a night out!

We wanted to show our two young (19 year old) guests a view of the city from up high.  We didnâ€™t have a reservation, but we were welcomed into the stunning bar area, where my husband and I had cocktails and the girls had soda. The staff were all extremely welcoming, and the cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced, given the location and the views. We were invited to wander the entire floor, allowing the girls to take photos of Manhattan in every direction.  We loved it so much that weâ€™re planning another trip, just for a special occasion, to have dinner at Manhatta.  Truly a special place in the city!

Went there to celebrate my birthday and it was an amazing experience! The service is attentive but not rushed, the food is unbelievably delicious! Will continue to dream about the mushroom and egg yolk dish for many moons to come! Truly a luxurious culinary experience worth every penny

My skepticism is high for places that open themselves up to relying on the view provided by being 60 floors up in NYC. I am happy to report though that this skepticism was absolutely smashed by the meal we had at Manhatta. The food from start to finish was stunning, incredibly palatable and far more complex than every high-up eatery Iâ€™ve been to. Not to mention the service was truly impressive, and such a breath of fresh air having experienced sub-par service in the US for so long. Not a single element of the experience was waited on, and every server was so incredibly pleasant. Thank you Manhatta for shattering my expectations, and canâ€™t wait to bring as many friends here as possible!

Lovely evening celebrating an important person's important birthday!  Spectacular views and wonderful food. Excellent sommelier and worked with me to make great wine suggestions. Professional service. Looking forward to returning!

Elevated dining with jaw-dropping viewsâ€”an unforgettable NYC experience

I recently had dinner at Manhatta, and everything from the ambiance to the flavors was absolutely exceptional. I did the 3-course prix fixe menu, and it was worth every penny. Each dish was beautifully presented and perfectly balanced in flavorâ€”refined without feeling overly fussy.

ğŸ½ï¸ Menu Highlights:
â€¢	My appetizer was light and refreshing, bursting with seasonal flavors.
â€¢	The main course (I chose the [insert your dish if youâ€™d like]) was rich, tender, and cooked to perfection.
â€¢	Dessert was both creative and satisfyingâ€”the perfect sweet finish.

The service was warm, attentive, and paced just right. The staff made thoughtful recommendations and explained each course with care.

ğŸŒ† Letâ€™s talk about the view: Manhatta is located on the 60th floor, and the panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and Brooklyn Bridge are just unrealâ€”especially at sunset. Itâ€™s romantic, modern, and makes you fall in love with NYC all over again.

ğŸ“ Location: 28 Liberty St, 60th Floor, New York, NY
ğŸ’µ Price: The 3-course menu is $148 per person (as of now), and absolutely worth it for the quality, setting, and service.
âœ¨ Perfect for: A date night, special celebration, or if you just want to treat yourself to a stunning evening in the city.

â¸»

If youâ€™re looking for a dining experience that combines elegant food with unforgettable views, Manhatta delivers on every level. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

First thing you notice is the view! Again, the view! Got a chance to try this place while I was visiting for the US Open, lucky I made reservations. It is a tasting menu so you get 4 courses. Everything was exceptional from the service, food and ambiance, very upscale.

Being greeted off the elevator by name is a lovely way to start your experience, then there is also the incredible view that never gets old!
We sat at the bar and our bartender was lovely. She made recommendations that were on point and was engaging.
As great as the above may beâ€¦ the burger is better!
I forgot to take a photo of it because it was gone almost no time.
The drinks and crudo was perfectly fine, but very pretty!

Through the years, Iâ€™ve been lucky enough to try many restaurants that left a mark in me, be it for an amazing dish, the kindness of a waiter, or some other detail. Thereâ€™s lots of great culinary experiences to have out there.

But only one can be your favourite. Only one such experience can be defined as â€œthe bestâ€. Manhatta is mine. I will never forget dining here, the impeccably kind staff, the mouth-watering food Iâ€™ve tried, and the amazing views from up on the 60th floor. The three East River cocktails I had probably also helped a lot.

If you only have one fine dining experience while youâ€™re in NYC, make it this one. You wonâ€™t regret it.

What a fabulous experience. The food was outstandingâ€”beautifully prepared and full of flavor. Service was warm, attentive, and totally on point without being overbearing. And the view? Absolutely stunningâ€”classic New York magic from above. Only downside: the wine pours were on the small side, especially for the price. Still, itâ€™s a special spot thatâ€™s well worth a visit when you want to feel like youâ€™re on top of the city (literally and figuratively).

The way I see it as a temporary visitor: you can either pay $50+ per person for some observatory tours, or you can pay $50+ per person for the same view plus some OK and somewhat inventive cuisine. We came in during lunch, had a drink each, tried their famous burger, and soaked up as much of the view as possible. Loved the binoculars, the informative and friendly staff, and of course, the unobstructed view of uptown, the three bridges, and the sweeping panorama which reminds me exactly why people fall in love with New York.

The food here is unreal, but the view puts it over the top. I loved everything about this experience. The service was great, the cocktails delicious, and the decor of the dining room was stunning. It was definitely worth the price tag.

Outstanding space and views on the 60th floor, and itâ€™s very impressive to watch the sun set (although the windows are north facing, the colors change and the lights come on).
But: despite the attentive service and the detailed presentation of the food, it ends up being prettyâ€¦ bland. Our party of four tried almost all combinations of the four course menu. We liked a couple of dishes (scallops, duck) but we found everything else wanting. The seabass and octopus were inferior to most Mediterranean restaurants. And the steak was inferior to most steakhouses.
Overall I am sorry to say that this restaurant is just a tourist trap. What a shame.
